title: Meta in talks to spend billions on Google's chips, The Information reports
summary: The talks also ‌involve Meta renting chips from Google Cloud as early as next year and are part of Google's broader push to get customers to adopt its ‌tensor processing units (TPUs) - used for AI workloads - in their own data centers, the report said, citing people involved in the talks.  The move would mark a departure from Google's current strategy of using TPUs only in its own data centers and could sharply expand the market for its chips, putting the company in direct competition for ⁠the hundreds of billions being spent on ‌data-center processors to power AI services.

title: What the S&P 500 is hiding about the economy
summary: On its face, 2025 has been a good year for the stock market. The S&P 500 was dragged out of its tariff-induced springtime slump by a small subset of AI-forward power players whose spectacular gains defied an otherwise softening economy. Even now, despite a rocky November, the benchmark index is up more than 12 percent since the start of the year. title: Trump Signs ‘Genesis Mission’ Order to Boost Innovation With AI
summary: The effort aims to better coordinate research done by agencies across the government and more effectively integrate AI tools to achieve more scientific breakthroughs, according to Michael Kratsios, the director of the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy, who spoke to reporters on the order ahead of Trump’s signature.  The mission will harness the computing resources of the Department of Energy’s national labs to tap federal datasets and enable more experiments utilizing AI, Kratsios added, predicting the effort would help shorten the timelines for scientific discoveries.

raw.headline: Trump Signs ‘Genesis Mission’ Order to Boost Innovation With AI
raw.summary: The effort aims to better coordinate research done by agencies across the government and more effectively integrate AI tools to achieve more scientific breakthroughs, according to Michael Kratsios, the director of the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy, who spoke to reporters on the order ahead of Trump’s signature.  The mission will harness the computing resources of the Department of Energy’s national labs to tap federal datasets and enable more experiments utilizing AI, Kratsios added, predicting the effort would help shorten the timelines for scientific discoveries.

title: Doubts remain over AI monetization, market expert says
summary: STORY: Sissel says investors are “looking for clarity” as uncertainty around China and Nvidia’s sales weighs on markets.She noted that “most of the revenue that Nvidia was able to achieve was with very little input from Chinese customers,” highlighting the market’s importance.Despite these concerns, Sissel pointed to a historical pattern, noting a “rough November, especially with the Nasdaq,” is “almost always followed by a very strong December.”

raw.headline: Doubts remain over AI monetization, market expert says
raw.summary: STORY: Sissel says investors are “looking for clarity” as uncertainty around China and Nvidia’s sales weighs on markets.She noted that “most of the revenue that Nvidia was able to achieve was with very little input from Chinese customers,” highlighting the market’s importance.Despite these concerns, Sissel pointed to a historical pattern, noting a “rough November, especially with the Nasdaq,” is “almost always followed by a very strong December.”

title: Investors fearful of AI bubble burst are missing out: Strategist
summary: Hennion & Walsh CIO Kevin Mahn doesn't believe the AI bubble is anywhere near bursting. Speaking with Josh Lipton on Market Domination Overtime, Mahn explains certain risk factors that could hinder the longevity of the current bull market while outlining why he agrees with Nvidia (NVDA) CEO Jensen Huang's outlook on the potential of the artificial intelligence industry. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

title: Why Google’s AI Wins Are Bad News for Nvidia Stock and the AI Trade
summary: A whizzy new chatbot, powered by artificial intelligence, has tech stocks jockeying for leadership of a volatile market amid new concerns over demand for  Nvidia  chips, the product behind Wall Street’s hottest stock.  It applies equally well to what is happening Monday following the launch of  Alphabet  new Gemini 3.  The company, whose stock is by far the best-performing member of the so-called Magnificent Seven so far this year, unveiled the latest version of its chatbot last week.

title: The Stock Market Needs December Magic to Keep Tech Rebound on Track
summary: “A short-term pullback in the broader U.S. equity market has been long overdue for a number of reasons, in our opinion, despite our constructive view on the year ahead,” said Lori Calvasina, head of U.S. equity strategy at RBC Capital Markets.  “Investors are questioning whether financial markets have run too far too fast and whether too much risk has been taken on” since this year’s rally began in early April, she added.  “The S&P 500 is back on a slower track than the fast track it was on from April 9 until the end of October,” said Ed Yardeni, president and chief investment strategist at Yardeni Research.

raw.headline: The Stock Market Needs December Magic to Keep Tech Rebound on Track
raw.summary: “A short-term pullback in the broader U.S. equity market has been long overdue for a number of reasons, in our opinion, despite our constructive view on the year ahead,” said Lori Calvasina, head of U.S. equity strategy at RBC Capital Markets.  “Investors are questioning whether financial markets have run too far too fast and whether too much risk has been taken on” since this year’s rally began in early April, she added.  “The S&P 500 is back on a slower track than the fast track it was on from April 9 until the end of October,” said Ed Yardeni, president and chief investment strategist at Yardeni Research.

title: Nvidia Stock Rises. The Tech Rally, China News, and More Propelling Shares Higher.
summary: Nvidia  stock found its direction on Monday, eventually joining the  in rallying.  First, the White House is considering letting Nvidia sell more of its chips to China, according to two reports at the end of last week from Reuters and Bloomberg, both of which cited anonymous sources.  The Trump administration could allow Nvidia to sell its H200 AI chip to China, according to the reports, as the U.S. Department of Commerce reviews its policy banning such high-end chip sales to the country.

title: Wall Street Needs Some Magic in December to Reignite Tired Tech Rally
summary: “A short-term pullback in the broader U.S. equity market has been long overdue for a number of reasons, in our opinion, despite our constructive view on the year ahead,” said Lori Calvasina, head of U.S. equity strategy at RBC Capital Markets.  “Investors are questioning whether financial markets have run too far too fast and whether too much risk has been taken on” since this year’s rally began in early April, she added.  “The S&P 500 is back on a slower track than the fast track it was on from April 9 until the end of October,” said Ed Yardeni, president and chief investment strategist at Yardeni Research.

raw.headline: Wall Street Needs Some Magic in December to Reignite Tired Tech Rally
raw.summary: “A short-term pullback in the broader U.S. equity market has been long overdue for a number of reasons, in our opinion, despite our constructive view on the year ahead,” said Lori Calvasina, head of U.S. equity strategy at RBC Capital Markets.  “Investors are questioning whether financial markets have run too far too fast and whether too much risk has been taken on” since this year’s rally began in early April, she added.  “The S&P 500 is back on a slower track than the fast track it was on from April 9 until the end of October,” said Ed Yardeni, president and chief investment strategist at Yardeni Research.
